intro: Aulomyrcia venulosa var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
